author: brane
msg: Clearing the field for issue #872.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/error.c (svn_handle_error): Stop using
svn_utf_utf8_to_native, now that each svn_error_t has its own pool;
use svn_utf_cstring_from_utf8_fuzzy instead. Also, don't convert the
file name in the error location output.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/utf.c (svn_utf_utf8_to_native): Remove.
(svn_utf_cstring_from_utf8_fuzzy): Clear the error before returning.
* subversion/include/svn_utf.h (svn_utf_utf8_to_native): Remove.

author: sussman
msg: Fix issue #1196: 'svn up' deletions are now 'obstructed' by local mods.
This is better than silently removing the modified item from version
control, which the user may not notice.  So now deletions (along with
additions) can be 'obstructed' and require user intervention, followed
by re-running 'svn up' to continue.
* svn_wc.h (svn_wc_remove_from_revision_control):  new 'instant_error' option.
* libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c (svn_wc_remove_from_revision_control):
Reorganize logic in this function so that it 1) has the ability to
instantly throw error when it sees a locally modified file, and 2)
is safely interruptible, leaving half-deleted dirs 'incomplete', so
'svn up' can still salvage them later.
(svn_wc_delete, svn_wc_revert): update callers -- pass FALSE for
'instant_error'.
* log.c (log_do_delete_entry): update caller -- pass TRUE for
'instant_error', and do *not* trap/discard specific errors anymore.
(log_do_committed, svn_wc__run_log): update callers -- pass FALSE for
'instant_error'.
* libsvn_client/externals.c (relegate_external,
handle_external_item_change): update callers -- pass FALSE for
'instant_error'.
* libsvn_wc/update_editor.c (delete_entry):  throw obstruction error
on a locally-modified file instantly.  In the directory case: catch
the LEFT_LOCAL_MOD error that might come back from running the log,
*remove* the logfile (since we know the wc is still consistent), and
throw an OBSTRUCTED_UPDATE error.
* update_tests.py (update_delete_modified_files): change this
regression test to expect 'obstructed update' error, rather than an
unversioned file.

author: maxb
msg: An incremental improvement aimed toward fixing issue 1515.
* tools/cvs2svn/cvs2svn.py (SymbolicNameTracker.copy_descend): Whether a path
was the root of a copy, or within a copy, we still need to record that it
was copied. Previously, the "within a copy" case was ignored.

author: blair
msg: Add a --username command line option to cvs2svn.py to change the
default username of 'unknown', which is used when cvs2svn.py creates a
branch or tag.
* cvs2svn.py
(make_revision_props): Take ctx as an argument to get the default
commit username.  Change all callers.
(usage): Add --username option.
* cvs2svn.1: Add documentation for --username.

author: julianfoad
msg: Improve the book Makefile so it updates when it should and doesn't when it
shouldn't.  It was always updating book-html-chunk, and never updating the
embedded revision number.
* doc/book/Makefile
Re-check the output of "svnversion" every time, but only update version.xml
if the revision number has changed.  (Previously version.xml was never
updated unless it had been deleted.)
Only rebuild book-html-chunk if it is older than its (main) source files.
(Previously it was re-built every time.)
The image files are now dependencies of most targets.
